Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; on body, alternating reserved and black concentric bands; exterior: wide black band at top rim, reserved lip and handle zone with band between; lower body glazed with reserved band near foot; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2 (possibly)
Curator's comments: The fabric and pattern of the cup find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type VIII (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116). Hayes' Type VIII is of the same shape as his Type IX (only the interior decoration is different) which coincides with Schlotzhauer's (Schlotzhauer 2012) Type 9A and Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus and the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
The name Telestratos is rare, appearing on Tenos and Rhodes in the Hellenistic period, apart from this attestation. Nothing in this text points to a specific origin.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (no. 32a)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 698, no. 554, pl. 23.2.10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.309) (Phase 3)
